intro: Siparuna exsculpta, commonly known as the waxy sycamore, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lythraceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, ovate leaves and showy, red floral clusters that appear in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. The bark of Siparuna exsculpta is thick and scaly, contributing to its common name.
